content:
Diagnosis:	Left renal cell carcinoma (acquired cystic disease-associated type)

Management:	12 March 2023 Left partial nephrectomy

Histology:	pT1b (4.5cm) acquired cystic disease-associated renal cell carcinoma, BCL2 positive, margins clear

Current Situation:	Routine surveillance

I reviewed [redacted name] in the renal oncology follow-up clinic today. He remains well at 14 months post partial nephrectomy with no concerning symptoms. His renal function remains stable with creatinine 156 (baseline 145-160). Recent surveillance CT chest/abdomen/pelvis from 15 April 2024 shows post-surgical changes in the left kidney with no evidence of recurrence or metastatic disease. The right kidney shows stable appearance of multiple simple cysts.

He continues on his usual renal medications and dialysis schedule which he tolerates well. His blood pressure is well controlled on current medications.

The plan is to continue surveillance with repeat CT in 6 months and clinical review thereafter. I have explained that we will maintain imaging follow-up for 5 years given his underlying renal disease. He understands to contact us sooner if he develops any new concerning symptoms.

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: acquired cystic disease-associated renal cell carcinoma, 4.5cm, margins clear

cancer_timeline.value: CT chest/abdomen/pelvis shows post-surgical changes in left kidney with no evidence of recurrence or metastatic disease

patient_facts.value: Right kidney shows stable appearance of multiple simple cysts

status_updates.value: Post-partial nephrectomy for renal cell carcinoma, no evidence of recurrence at 14 months follow-up
